body:
Hello everyone. I have an exelent idea to introduce to everyone.
So, in every comment, we should have a little comment saying ( Like ) and one saying ( dislike ).


  • Why?
  • This is where my idea starts.The Like & Deslike button it's a new command that will give feedback about your posts and, if possible, a table will appear in your profile saying how many Positives likes do you have. 
  • Ex: 20 Likes & 2 Deslikes = 18 Likes
  • Why is this useful?
  • The positive likes will decide if you can be an Member of the week.
Useful informations for the Member of the Week.


  • A table will appear in the initial page of the Avicus network with the Top 5 members with more positive likes and those are who can get the Member of the Week.
  • The Member of the week will be a sign in Teamspeack that allows you to join the Premium Suite [ and maybe 5k - 10k credits in the Avicus server ].
This is an idea, not an Oficcial release. I'm saying this idea with the hope that the Devs can actually do this in the forums and in Teamspeack.

Regards
xToby

title: Likes & Member of the Week.

replies.body:
I would be keen just to have a like button and no dislike button.

People could just troll and bully people by spamming dislikes.
replies.body_tagged:
I would be keen just to have a like button and no dislike button.

People could just troll and bully people by spamming dislikes.

replies.body:
It can be easily abused. 
It will become a great emotional pressure on ppl, who will get a tons of dislikes. I saw, how it works on other forums. They may just leave. We already have enough insults here without this.
replies.body_tagged:
It can be easily abused. 
It will become a great emotional pressure on ppl, who will get a tons of dislikes. I saw, how it works on other forums. They may just leave. We already have enough insults here without this.

replies.body: It won't work, it's abusable, not that hard to spam likes
replies.body_tagged: It won't work, it's abusable, not that hard to spam likes

replies.body: I see that the dislike button is abusable. Maybe I'll just remove that idea and I'll just put the like button.
replies.body_tagged: I see that the dislike button is abusable. Maybe I'll just remove that idea and I'll just put the like button.

replies.body: No people can just spam the like button anyhow and get like member of the week

replies.body: Yeah I agree, like button would be nice

replies.body: I mean TBH we shouldn't have it, I'll shame the others with how many likes I'll get

replies.body: But you could have to waite to give likes like when you need to waite to write comments.

replies.body:
This is YouTube.

YouTube has a likes and dislikes Format.

YouTube is toxic and has a lot of drama, scams and bullshit liars.

Don't be like YouTube.

But really like the idea just no dislike button pls.
